title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Thursday 22 March - BBC News
summary: reward of £ 20,000 for information on wigston death .
man arrested after karaoke bar shooting .
puppy rescued from collapsed mine shaft .

documents.title: 'paedo hunter ' sex offender killed himself
text: 'paedo hunter ' sex offender killed himself

documents.title: sterling-james rejoins solihull on loan
text: sterling-james rejoins solihull on loan

documents.title: derby 'correct ' to call off cardiff match
text: derby 'correct ' to call off cardiff match

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage for this region has now ended for thursday , but some news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear overnight .
east midlands live will return from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: body found in nature reserve
text: police searching for a missing woman in beeston have recovered a body .
it was found in the water at attenborough nature reserve earlier this afternoon .
police said it has not yet been identified but the family of sarah wright have been made aware of the discovery .
the 38-year-old woman was reported missing on 15 march 2018 .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: 'iconic ' trees to return to city park
text: the `` three sisters '' or `` topper 's spinney '' - whatever you called them - the `` iconic '' trees are set to return to victoria park in leicester .
for years the three trees stood at the centre of the park but in the late 1970s they became infected with dutch elm disease and had to be removed .
a variety of disease-resistant elm trees are now being planted in their place .

deputy city mayor adam clarke said : by reintroducing a new species of elm at the same spot that these trees stood some 40 years ago , we 're able to restore an iconic part of the park 's horticultural history .
we hope they stand as a monument to the city 's attitude to trees for generations to come . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: ricky slade inquest : jury criticises monitoring failures
text: a decision to stop monitoring the mental health of child sex offender ricky slade was `` unsuitable '' and `` based on inadequate information '' , an inquest into his death has said .
slade was classed as a vulnerable prisoner because of his offences , and his mental health was being monitored after he cut his left wrist on 25 january .
slade was also interviewed by a newly-qualified nurse on 2 february as part of an assessment , where he was found to be `` in a low mood '' .
the inquest jury , in nottingham , heard the nurse had not read all the forms on slade and did not contact prison staff following the assessment .
they returned a conclusion of suicide .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: broken-down freight train causes cancellations
text: east midlands trains says trains can not run in either direction between newark castle and lincoln central .
services between nottingham and leicester also face cancellations as crew are `` trapped on the wrong side of the broken-down train '' .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: horn honked at ambulance for 30 minutes
text: horn honked at ambulance for 30 minutes

documents.title: family seek answers over son 's death
text: the father of mark cookson has made a plea for information about how his son died three years ago .
the 42-year-old 's body was found at his flat on leicester road , wigston , in march 2015 .
three days earlier he 'd been involved in an argument on hillcrest road .
crimestoppers has offered a £ 10,000 reward for information about mark 's death .
the cookson family is offering an additional £ 10,000 .
i know my son died from a fractured skull and the associated bleed on his brain .
but , three years on , we still do n't know how he came by that head injury .
for three , long years my family has waited for an answer to that question .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: x factor : auditions coming to oakham
text: bill 's bar in oakham has been chosen to host open auditions for the x factor tv show after one of the owners sent videos of talented singers at open mic nights there .
jonathan spencer who owns the bar said the auditions are a great opportunity for talented local performers to showcase their work .
many people have told him they did n't expect the tv show to come to rutland .
the auditions take place on 25 april .
author: Bridget Blair
BBC Radio Leicester Reporter

documents.title: man charged after attack on mental health worker
text: a man has been charged after a member of staff was reportedly stabbed at a mental health unit in nottingham .
police were called to the unit on thorneywood mount after reports a woman had been stabbed in the back at about 07:20 on tuesday .
nottinghamshire healthcare confirmed the staff member was treated at the queen 's medical centre but has since been discharged .
a 30-year-old man was charged with grievous bodily harm and has been remanded into custody .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: released robbers raided more banks
text: released robbers raided more banks

documents.title: puppy rescued from collapsed mine shaft
text: a golden retriever puppy has been rescued after falling 20ft down a collapsed mine shaft in the peak district .
the accident happened on eldon hill around the area of slitherstone mine .
buxton mountain rescue used a `` rope rescue '' devise to bring the four-month-old pup back to the surface .
the rescue team said : `` she was very cold but walked off to the vets for a check up . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: bid to block derby incinerator fails at high court
text: campaigners who opposed plans for a waste-to-energy incineration plant in derby have failed in a bid to block the proposals at the high court .
energy company envirofusion ltd won permission to test its waste disposal system at its base on the former hanson concrete works , on alfreton road , last year .
the proposals allow for testing of the new system for 18-months and for a 20m chimney at the site .
the opposing the alfreton road incinerator group challenged derby city council 's decision to grant planning permission at the high court but their application for a judicial review was refused .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: fire crews leave scene of industrial fire
text: derbyshire fire and rescue service has now left pye bridge industrial estate following an earlier fire .
one of the units , which had cars inside , caught alight just before 10:00 .
people living in the area were told to keep windows and doors closed .
there were 11 fire crews at the scene tackling the blaze , including two from nottinghamshire .
the scale of the damage is not yet known .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: foreign secretary 'appalled ' by mariam moustafa death
text: foreign secretary boris johnson has said he was `` appalled '' by the death of mariam moustafa .
the 18-year-old student died on wednesday , three weeks after she was allegedly punched repeatedly by six women on a bus in nottingham .

mr johnson said : `` clearly it 's not a true reflection of our society of the kind of welcome people can expect here in the uk and i hope that the police and the law enforcement agencies can get to the bottom of it as soon as possible . ''
a 17-year-old girl , who was arrested on sus of assault occasioning grievous bodily harm , remains on bail .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: road reopens following explosion
text: one lane is now open on the citybound side of hinckley road in leicester .
the stretch of road between woodville road and king richards road has been closed since an explosion on 25 february , which killed five people .
the other lane will remain closed as works continue there .
the city council confirmed demolition work at the site finished yesterday .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: man arrested after karaoke bar shooting
text: a 24-year-old man has been arrested in connection with a shooting in nottingham city centre .
he is being questioned on sus of causing grievous bodily harm after a 25-year-old man was shot outside intrigue karaoke lounge and bar on huntingdon street .
the injured man was taken to the queen 's medical centre on 10 march but has since been discharged .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: newark woman , 20 , is named as leeds fatal crash victim
text: a 20-year-old woman who died after being hit by a private hire car in leeds last weekend has been named by police .
alice walton was a student at the university of leeds and is from newark in nottinghamshire .
she died on monday after being hit by the car on woodhouse street at about 04:30 on saturday morning .
the driver of a silver vw passat stopped at the scene and has been interviewed by police .
west yorkshire police are now appealing for witnesses , or people who helped ms walton after the crash , to get in touch .
we are working with our colleagues in nottinghamshire police to support alice 's family .
the family have said they are heartbroken and devastated by their loss . ''

documents.title: man injured in karaoke bar shooting
text: man injured in karaoke bar shooting

documents.title: ground broken on rolls-royce testbed
text: this was the moment the building of a new rolls-royce testbed began in derby earlier .
ground is broken on rolls-royce 's 7,000-job securing engine test bed .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: breakingsuicide verdict in child sex offender prison death
text: a coroner has recorded a verdict of suicide in the inquest into the death of child sex offender ricky slade .
the 30-year-old , who was confronted by a self-styled `` paedophile hunting '' group , was found hanged in his cell at hmp nottingham while awaiting sentence in february 2017 .
he had admitted three counts of attempting to incite a child under 13 to engage in sexual activity and one count of attempting to meet a child under 16 following grooming .
author: Liam Barnes
BBC News

documents.title: church 'pleased ' decision upheld over gay canon tribunal
text: the church has said it is pleased that the court of appeal has upheld its decision over gay canon jeremy pemberton , who was prevented from working as a hospital chaplain after marrying his partner .

the canon brought claims of discrimination and harassment against the former acting bishop of southwell and nottingham , the rt rev richard inwood , but these were rejected by both the employment tribunal and the employment appeal tribunal .
a spokesman for the diocese of southwell & nottingham said : `` we are pleased the court has upheld the decision made with regards to the employment tribunal .
`` we recognise that this has been a long and difficult process for many of those concerned and we hold them in our thoughts and prayers . ''
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: boris johnson campaigning in chaddesden
text: foreign secretary boris johnson has been campaigning in chaddesden this afternoon .
he treated himself to some local produce - a thornton 's easter egg with boris inscribed on it and a sausage roll from birds .
author: Chris Doidge
BBC Radio Derby, political reporter

documents.title: hospital appointments postponed
text: many planned operations across nottingham 's hospitals have been postponed next week to avoid further pressures on the health service .
earlier this week , the entire system was put on its highest level of alert - known as opel 4 .
non-urgent operations have been put on hold until at least next thursday .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: police appeal for stolen tortoise
text: a tortoise has been stolen from a shop south wigston .
police said it is a hermann 's tortoise , like the one
they would like to hear from anyone who knows of a person who has recently acquired a tortoise or if they have been offered one for sale .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: government visit to rolls-royce
text: the business secretary has been in derby to see the start of work on a new testbed facility at rolls-royce .
the 7,500sqm building will be used to test the current trent xwb and trent 1000 engines as well as the new ultrafan engine to be used in the next generation of aircraft .
once complete , it will be the largest indoor facility of its type in the world .

the highly talented workforce in derby will spearhead rolls-royce 's ambition to increase engine production to record levels and ensure the uk remains at the pinnacle of engineering and aerospace excellence .
this revolutionary facility is exactly the type of investment our modern industrial strategy will continue to attract . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: man on motorbike 'swung machete ' at teen
text: a 16-year-old boy has reported being confronted by a man with a machete in nottingham .
the teenager claims the weapon , like this one was swung at him but did not injure him .
police said the attacker was one of two men that approached him on a motorbike on wilford lane , wilford , yesterday afternoon .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: fire service rush to city centre 'false alarm '
text: if you were wondering why the fire service was out in force near leicester railway station earlier , do n't worry - it was a false alarm .
a concerned member of the public called leicestershire fire and rescue after seeing smoke coming from one of the buildings on st georges way .
it turned out to be nothing serious .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: drivers urged to 'avoid ' m1 over may weekend
text: if you 're planning a weekend away in may , you might want to avoid a certain area of the east midlands .
at 22:00 on friday 11 may the m1 will close between j23a and j24 .
it wo n't reopen until 15:00 on sunday 13 may .
during this time , there will be a traffic diversion route along the a453 .
the closure will allow the kegworth bypass bridge to be installed over the motorway .
the bridge is part of the development of the east midlands gateway - the 700-acre logistics park with a rail freight terminal .
segro , the company behind the works , said : `` as the m1 is one of the uk 's busiest motorways , we expect significant congestion and delays .
`` therefore we advise drivers avoid this area if possible and allow for extra time for their journey - in particular if travelling to east midlands airport . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: black smoke rising from industrial estate fire
text: this is the scene of the fire at an industrial unit in pye bridge .
people living in the area are being advised to keep their windows and doors closed .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: teenage stroke victim 's road to recovery
text: ashley martin , from barrow upon soar , suffered a stroke during a driving lesson aged just 17 .
but he 's now back behind the wheel .
take a look at his amazing story .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: 'no violation of dignity ' in gay canon case
text: gay canon jeremy pemberton , who was prevented from working as a hospital chaplain after marrying his partner , lost his case in the court of appeal today .
he accused the church of breaching the 2010 equality act , but lost an appeal against an employment tribunal in 2016 .
the court of appeal heard canon pemberton 's case in january but has also now dismissed his case .

in a written ruling lord justice underhill said he had `` no difficulty understanding how profoundly upsetting canon pemberton must find the church of england 's official stance on same-sex marriage and its impact on him '' .

`` but it does not follow that it was reasonable for him to regard his dignity as violated , or an 'intimidating , hostile , degrading , humiliating or offensive ' environment as having been created for him , by the church applying its sincerely-held beliefs in a way expressly permitted by schedule 9 of the ( equality ) act .

`` if you belong to an institution with known , and lawful , rules , it implies no violation of dignity , and it is not cause for reasonable offence , that those rules should be applied to you - however wrong you may believe them to be , '' the judge said .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: rugby : barrow leaves tigers
text: dom barrow has been released from his contract at leicester tigers and is leaving the club with immediate effect .
the second-row forward has played 52 times for the club , making his last starting appearance against the falcons at the end of october .
he will join la rochelle until the end of the season as medical cover .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: leicestershire record third successive profit
text: leicestershire have announced a net profit for the third consecutive year .
the foxes made £ 3,620 in 2017 , down slightly from £ 8,813 .
between 2012 and 2014 the foxes made cumulative losses totaling more than £ 500,000 .
it 's been a lot of hard work from the all staff at the club .
the same staff are here that were here three years ago .
we 're probably one of only one or two counties who can boast that we 've returned a net profit for three years in a row .
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: pupils at a leicester school make a buzz with music
text: school children in leicester are among the first in the country to test a pioneering new musical instrument .
it 's called 'p-buzz ' and sounds like a brass instrument - but is made entirely of plastic .
it 's designed by the midlands based company warwick music group , who 've teamed up with the charity music for all to distribute them at selected schools .
thanks to this partnership , pupils at alderman richard hallam primary school can now play more brass music .
author: Khush Sameja
BBC Radio Leicester reporter

documents.title: broad claims 400th test wicket
text: england were bowled out for just 58 in day one of the first test against new zealand .
but there was some good news for nottinghamshire 's stuart broad who claimed his 400th wicket .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: two-storey building 'well alight '
text: more information about the fire at pye bridge industrial estate :

10:08 # alfreton white , # alfreton rds , # chesterfield white , # ilkeston rds , @ twitterid # ashfield # eastwood and the alp from chesterfield are using 1 main jet and 2 hose reel jets on several cars on fire inside a building at pye bridge ind est , somercotes
this is a two storey industrial unit which is well alight 30m x 30m .
the alp is being used for firefighting from height an 2ba also in use
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: resident warning over industrial estate fire
text: people in somercotes are being advised to keep to their doors and windows closed because of a fire at the pye bridge industrial estate .
derbyshire police are asking people to stay away from the area and warn a number of roads are likely to be closed .
there are not thought to be any injuries .

10:08 # alfreton white , # alfreton rds , # chesterfield white , # ilkeston rds , @ twitterid # ashfield # eastwood and the alp from chesterfield are using 1 main jet and 2 hose reel jets on several cars on fire inside a building at pye bridge ind est , somercotes
this is a two storey industrial unit which is well alight 30m x 30m .
the alp is being used for firefighting from height an 2ba also in use
@ twitterid
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: tennis : boulter out in first round
text: the british women 's number four has been knocked out of the miami open .
katie boulter , from woodhouse eaves , leicestershire , was beaten 6-4 7-5 by hsieh su-wei of chinese taipei .
it was the 21-year-old 's maiden premier event and reaching the first round will see her break into the top 200 next week .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: gay canon wo n't appeal further
text: in a statement , canon jeremy pemberton said his appeal had been dismissed and he had agreed with the church that he would not appeal further .

he said : `` the church of england has established through this process that it can continue to discriminate legally against some lgbt people in relation to their employment , even where that employment is not within the boundaries of the church 's jurisdiction .
`` this will seem to most people in the uk today an extraordinary result , and not one that will help commend the claims of christ to the nation . ''
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: breakinggay canon loses case in court of appeal
text: a gay clergyman prevented from working as a hospital chaplain after marrying his partner has lost his case in the court of appeal .
canon jeremy pemberton wanted to work as a hospital chaplain but was refused permission to officiate by the then acting bishop of southwell and nottingham , richard inwood .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: hmic praise 'good ' police force
text: a report into the effectiveness of leicestershire police has said the force is good at keeping people safe and reducing crime .
an investigation by her majesty 's inspectorate of constabulary ( hmic ) found leicestershire police had made good progress since its 2016 effectiveness inspection .
there was praise for a new `` digital hub '' set up to deal with cyber-crimes .
hmic called it a `` very effective way of tackling online child sexual exploitation '' .

a series of major incidents , combined with the real and present national terrorism threat , the changing nature of criminality , and an increase in demand for services really piled the pressure on capacity this year , but they have never given up .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: chatsworth to reopen after £ 32m restoration
text: chatsworth house has completed its biggest restoration project for almost 200 years .
the decade-long programme costing more than £ 32m aimed to restore the derbyshire house and gardens to their full glory .
the whole exterior of the 300-room house has been cleaned after weather damage and industrial pollution over hundreds of years took its toll .
the house has its spring reopening this weekend and a special exhibition telling the story behind the restoration process will run until october .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: trams running again after power cut
text: a spokesperson for nottingham tram operator net has now told us trams are up and running again after the power cut .
he said there are delays to services and apologised to customers .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: trams stopped over power failure
text: net has now confirmed all trams in nottingham have been halted due to a power cut .
service update : due to a power failure we currentlry have all trams on hold .
we do have ticket acceptanace on all nct buses and would ask that you seek alternative transport at this time , we will have a further update soon .
is there an update on progress please ?
all now running through .
thanks
yawn !
again ?
what a waste of money .
# whiteelephanttransport
this tram network is a shambles .
this is becoming a weekly thing ! !
@ twitterid reports are people are happy with the tram
you lot are bloody useless
have n't a ticket due to use if mango card
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: trams hit by power cut
text: net customer information line has just told me power has been lost across the whole network in nottingham and no trams are running .
a tram driver told me the same at the university boulevard stop .
author: Steve Beech
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: girl , 13 , in hospital after ilkeston crash
text: police have now confirmed the pedestrian hit by a car in ilkeston this morning was a 13-year-old girl .
she has been taken to hospital with injuries which are not thought to be `` life changing '' .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: pedestrian hit by car in ilkeston
text: a female pedestrian has been hit by a car in ilkeston , police have confirmed .
it happened on ladywood road at about 07:55 .
the road was closed but has now reopened .
no further details have yet been released .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: thakor banned for six months by ecb
text: thakor banned for six months by ecb

documents.title: lane closure near nottingham station
text: a lane will be out of action near nottingham railway station this morning .
lane closure on queens road near nottingham station to fix damaged kerb today 9.30 - 12
why not put a dropped kerb in near the bike storage place while you are there ?
# askingforafriend
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: mark cookson death : family appeal three years on
text: the family of a man who was found dead in his flat in leicester three years ago have re-appealed for information .
mark cookson was involved in an argument on hillcrest road , leicester , at about 18:30 on 22 march , 2015 , police said .
the 42-year-old 's body was found at his home on leicester road , wigston , three days later .
police said he died as a result of a fractured skull and associated bleed on his brain .
two men and a woman , who were arrested on sus of manslaughter days after the body was found , were released with no further action taken .
mr cookson 's family have teamed up with crimestoppers to offer a £ 20,000 reward for information .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: road blocked after crash
text: drivers have been asked to avoid ashby road near shepshed after a collision .
# leics .
rtc .
b5324 ashby rd , nr .
m1 bridge .
2 vehicles .
emergency services at scene .
road is blocked .
avoid if poss .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online

documents.title: egyptian officials to visit nottingham over student death
text: egyptian government officials are due to arrive in nottingham today to investigate the death of student mariam moustafa .
they are expected to meet members of mariam 's family , as well as representatives from a number of organisations and agencies .
a spokesman said their main aim was to get all the information about mariam 's case and make sure justice was served .
the 18-year-old , who had dual egyptian and italian citizenship , died three weeks after being attacked by a group of girls in nottingham city centre .
police said they have identified six suspects and are building a clear of what happened during the alleged assault last month .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: weather : bright start but cloudy later
text: here 's how it 's looking in the east midlands today .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: girl , 15 , charged over fatal stabbing
text: a fourth teenager has been charged with murdering a 17-year-old who was chased and stabbed in nottinghamshire .
the 15-year-old girl is due before nottingham magistrates later accused of lyrico steede 's murder .
lyrico died six days after suffering a number of injuries in the attack in stock well , bulwell , in february .
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: good morning .
it 's me and amy woodfield bringing you today 's latest news , sport , travel and weather updates for the east midlands .
author: Heather Burman
Journalist, BBC News Online
